alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued May 07 at 7:48PM PDT until May 08 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT SUNDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 11 PM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet with dangerous rip currents. For the Beach Hazards Statement, dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf of 3 to 6 feet. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 5 AM to 11 PM PDT Sunday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, through late tonight. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The wave heights will increase to high surf criteria after 5 am Sunday.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks. Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
